messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Please, help.
Hello? Yes, what's your emergency?
We've just been robbed.
Where are you?
220 South Sea Street.
220 South Sea. Okay, we have officers headed your way. Are you safe right now?
I'm in my bedroom.
You're in your bedroom, okay. Is anyone else there with you?
Yes, my sister. My mom and stepdad went to the pawn shop, and they stole the iPad and the PS3.
Are you all in the bedroom by yourselves?
Yes.
Stay right there, okay?
Yes, sir.
Did you see how many people came in?
Like four or five.
Can you hear anyone else in the house?
No, I think they went to my mom's bedroom.
Okay, we're chasing some of them right now. So you stay right where you are and stay on the line with me, okay?
Yes, sir. Should I go into the closet?
If that'll make you feel safer, you can do that, okay?
Yes, sir.
Alright, stay in the closet if you feel safer. Officers are out there.
Yes, sir. I have my little sister with me. We're both hiding.
Okay. The officers will be entering the house. If you hear something, it'll probably be them. Stay where you are until they find you.
I can hear them.
Alright. Just stay on the line with me. They'll be coming through the house slowly.
Yes, sir.
If you hear them open the door, say 'It's us,' okay?
Yes, sir.
You're doing great.
They're here.
Okay, don't open the door until they tell you to.
They told us to open the door. It's the police.
Alright, you're safe now. Good job.
Thank you. Bye.
